title: Meet the Breeds
description: Encounter pups from Affenpinschers to Yorkshire Terriers and everything in between at the American Kennel Club’s annual Meet the Breeds event, featuring over 130 different dog breeds to meet, play with, and learn about.
address: Jacob K. Javits Convention Center (Hell’s Kitchen)
cost: $30 general with promo code ‘bellyrubs’ (reg. $35), $20 seniors/students, $10 kiddos

title: New York Travel + Adventure Show
description: Explore the world under one roof at the annual New York Travel + Adventure Show, where exhibitors showcase destinations, tour operators, cruise lines, hotels, and more.

title: Anne Frank: The Exhibition
description: For the first time in history, Anne Frank House presents an experience outside of Amsterdam to immerse visitors in a full-scale recreation of the rooms where Anne Frank, her parents and sister, and four other Jewish inhabitants spent two years hiding to evade Nazi capture.

title: Eli Yudin Comedy Special Taping
description: Comedian Eli Yudin (Cracked, CollegeHumor) tapes a stand-up special at The Gutter in Greenpoint.
cost: $5-10 (all proceeds will be donated to LA wildfire relief)

title: Bitches Brew Comedy Show
description: See what all the brew-ha-ha is about at this women-produced and-hosted comedy show, returning to the back room at Halyards (Gowanus) with stand-up by Vannessa Jackson (SNL), Carson Olshansky (Reductress), Brey Raybould (Race: The Movie: The Play), Igor Martinez, and Michael Schirtzer.
cost: Free (a tip jar will be passed around at the end of the show)

title: The Drunk Texts: The Merry Busters of Ghosts
description: Catch a Shakespearean adaptation of a movie classic paired with drinking games and audience participation at Random Access Theatre’s ‘The Drunk Texts’ series.

title: Drunk Planet Earth
description: MST3K meets Animal Planet meets drinking game at Brian Morabito and Mick Szal’s participatory Drunk Planet Earth show.

title: Corpse Flower at Brooklyn Botanic Garden
description: A giant corpse flower (amorphophallus titanum) is poised to bloom any day now, releasing an aroma that’s been likened to rotting flesh. The phenomenon normally lasts only about 24-36 hours, so check the venue’s social media for updates.
cost: Pay-what-you-wish winter weekdays, $22 general/$16 seniors + students weekends

title: The 71st Winter Show
description: Discover a dazzling array of paintings, fine furniture, works on paper, ceramics, glass, jewelry, and rare books from 70 exhibitors at the winter show, an annual art, antiques, and design fair. Your ticket includes access to panel discussions, and proceeds from admission will benefit East Side House Settlement.

title: David Lynch Screenings
description: IFC Center, Look Cinemas, and Village East by Angelika pay tribute to filmmaker David Lynch with screenings through next week.
address: IFC Center, Look Cinemas, Village East by Angelika

title: 27th Annual Postcards from the Edge
description: Visual Aids’s signature benefit event, Postcards from the Edge, returns to Berry Campbell Gallery in Tribeca with over 1,500 postcard-sized artworks created anonymously by both established and emerging artists. Each piece is priced at $100, and the identity of each artwork’s creator will be revealed only after purchase.
cost: $100 admission for preview party, free admission for exhibition
